page.title: 10NEWCASTLETON FOREST
page.content:
{
{NEWCASTLETON FOREST The{Newcastleton Forest}covers 4 and a quarter of our area.In{Newcastleton's {Forest}many different kinds of{trees grow like the Norway{Spruce },Sitka {Spruce},Larch and Scotch Pine.You can tell the difference between the Norway{Spruce}and the Sitka{Spruce as the Sitka{Spruce}is bluey-green underneath and the Norway{Spruce}has not.The Larch is a light green colour.The Scotch Pine is a dark green colour.The{trees}are felled and then snedded (branches taken off) either by chainsaw or using a processer (contract work)The Kockum and the Bruunett Forwarder picks up the felled{trees}and puts them in stacks.Most of the{trees}go to be made into paper,chipboard &furniture
